特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
関連科目: Business-Government Relations in East Asia 13.30-15.00 on Wed. Spring Semester; and Japan in a Globalizing World 13.00-15.00 on Wed Fall Semester
授業方法: In the spring semester, there will be weekly seminars on Japan's development followed by a series of study of global issues. In the Fall Semester, we will discuss major issues facing the 21st century. By the end of Fall Semester, all students must  submit 4-5,000 words research paper followed by oral presentations.

第1回:
Introduction to the Course & Defining Research Objectives and Significance
Global Issues 1:

1. Read this syllabus and understand the structure and requirements of this seminar course.
2. Write up a reflection on the research project you completed last year.
第2回:
Research Papers: Reflections and New Tasks
Research: To define research topics and significance.
Global Issues 2:

1. Propose three possible research topics and their significance.
2. Explain and comment on what Prof. 1. Harari views as major challenges of this century after watching Documentary in URL 1 below.
第3回:
Group workshop: Topics and Significance
Research: Group Workshop
Global Issues 3:

1. Narrow down to one research topic together with well-defined significance.
2. Discuss the challenges which COVID-19 presents for us, after watching Documentary in URL 2 below
第4回:
Research: What is today? What do we need to advance?
Global Issues 4:
1.Develop a perspective to understand ourselves and challenges and opportunities after watching URL 3 below
第5回:
Research: Images, Stereo Types and Myth vs Reality
Global Issues 5:

1. Was the postwar Japanese constitution made and imposed by the Allied Powers?
2. Increase an understanding of image and reality in political debate and advance critical thinking skills.
第6回:
Research: Understand how social sciences can be value-driven
Global Issues 6:

1. Was the American Occupation successful? Why/why not?
2. What is the impact of the Occupation on postwar Japanese development?
第7回:
Research: Contending Paradigms of Political Economy (Understand analytical, methodological and normative orientations of major paradigms of political economy)
Global Issues7:
1. Was the high economic growth of the 1960s a "miracle"? If not, explain its causes, employing major paradigms of political economy.
第8回:
Research: Apply contending theories and understand its consequences.
